skillTree.localised_description: After the Living Shade’s untimely demise, the Crowe seized the master assassin’s arsenal and augmented his own with it.

effects.description: This character becomes able to see enemies hiding in forest regardless of distance

skillTree.localised_description: The Black Crowe never meets face-to-face with his contractors; instead, he sends street urchins with wax-sealed envelopes to collect his contracts.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: There are some deals that it would be extremely unwise to renege on…
The Goddess of War has blessed this one for his combat prowess.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: A wise assassin will simply let his target tire himself out before attempting a killing blow.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: After assassinating the prominent noble, Count Banquo Degusta, the Black Crowe decided to take on his identity and, with it, his mercantile empire. The Crowe now lives in the Count’s own estate, Degusta’s Bastion, where the guards and staff hired by the real Degusta remain completely oblivious to the true identity of their master.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations : +2 with the Southern Realms
Diplomatic relations : +6 with the Southern Realms
Diplomatic relations : +10 with the Southern Realms

skillTree.localised_description: The Crowe has not sat idle after taking over Degusta’s empire. He has made several new acquisitions in Miragliano, Remas and Verezzo to support his Guild, his Prince and himself.

The Crowe usually travels light, but he is ten times as deadly as any other assassin. Hidden under his robes, he carries an assortment of sharp blades; a small blowgun and a kit of poisons, sedatives & antidotes.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"
Ability number of uses: +2 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"

skillTree.localised_description: Injecting small doses of poison regularly has made the Black Crowe immune to almost all poisons found in the Old World, a strength he uses to its full potential when dealing with especially tricky targets.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

skillTree.localised_description: Though the Crowe is a ruthless and efficient assassin, he does not kill without reason. The Crowe operates under a strict set of tenets dictated by the Assassin’s Code, a rare characteristic for a man with such infamy.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +12 for Guild Assassins
	(all armies)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The Black Crowe expertly retired the previous master assassin of the Guild, the man known as Rannick the Living Shade, using the Crowe’s disguise as Count Degusta. The Crowe is now the single greatest killer on the market, though his services come at a steep cost, especially if you are not of Luccinian nobility.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +5%
	(Heroes in local province)
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: "I spy with my beady eye… something that needs to be killed."
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Such champions are adept at delivering a Killing Blow, depriving the foe of life with a single, powerful attack.

attributes.bullet_text: A unit with Executioner will execute units in combat below a 20% hit points threshold.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: “My knife, you see, is coated in poison. Take care, for it has... quite a burn.”
“They harvest this in Estalia. In battle, it turns the enemy to paper. And if I have to go another hour without some, I’ll lose it.”
“The Arabyans leave venom to fester in the carcass of a rat for weeks before grinding it into powder. Imagine this inside you.”
“It’s a beautiful flower, but try to resist the urge to sniff it. It grows only in soil nourished by decay. Its seed can turn a bloody battlefield into a vast, noxious amaranthine thicket.”
“I can be anyone, anywhere, anytime. I could even be the bullet in your pistol.”

effects.description: Sucess Chance of  "Borgio Brew", "Null Stone Powder", "Ruby Sulphur Extract": +12
Action Cost of "Borgio Brew", "Null Stone Powder", "Ruby Sulphur Extract": +30%

skillTree.localised_description: “A sprig of hemlock, a pinch of belladonna, a little bit of spice. This lovely concoction will leave a brute like you a tangled mess of contorted limbs.”

effects.description: Damages Army general and leaves him weakened for the rest of battle

skillTree.localised_description: “We use a Null Stone when we need to keep magic out of ourselves. Ground into a flavourless powder, we use it when we need to keep magic out of someone else.”

effects.description: Reduces Winds of magic amount and recharge rate of Army General

skillTree.localised_description: “In the old days, you would have to ply a man with a good few tankards of Bugman’s, so he wouldn’t be able to taste the poison in his supper. That was true until they discovered this down in the mines.”

effects.description: Increases wound time of Army General

skillTree.localised_description: "I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

items.colour_text: A gold ring with a distinctive symbol of a crow in flight. The Crowe carries the antidote for his most potent airborne poison within a small compartment inside the ring.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Guild Assassin
	(factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"

items.colour_text: His robes look rather mundane and inelegant at first glance but, in truth, it is a clever misdirection. Using funds from Degusta’s treasury, the Crowe ordered the creation of the finest piece of clothing an assassin could ever wish for: an inconspicuous attire that is lined with light but sturdy material capable of stopping a blade from cutting too deep.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"

items.colour_text: A striking matte black mask shaped like the beak of a crow. A terrifying image for those who know of the Black Crowe and his deeds.

effects.description: Enables ability: Marked by the Crowe

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"

items.colour_text: Two obsidian-black daggers blessed by the cultists at the Theatre of Ravens in Luccini. These blessed blades will penetrate the thickest armour and send the souls of their wearers to Morr’s realm.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Crimson Shade", "Scorpion Venom & "Mousillon Rose"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Black Crowe is an extremely skilled and dangerous man, who rapidly climbed the ranks of the Assassins Guild by orchestrating a series of skilful executions, including those of Pirate Prince Manlect the Obese of Sartosa and Count Banquo Degusta of Miragliano.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead
Assault Garrison action: Additional 25% casualties inflicted
